inventory.commentary: Adding idioms off_one's_head, out_of_one's_head, over_one's_head, by_the_head, stood_on_its_head, head_to_head, head_and_shoulders

sense.name: the cranium, uppermost portion of the human anatomy
sense.commentary: HEAD[+anatomical][+animal][+uppermost] the upper part of the human body or the front part of the body in animals; contains the face and brains
sense.examples: He suffered severe head injuries in the accident. There are cases of two-headed calves on record. John has a thick head of hair. His firm is still holding its head high despite the scandal from last year. (metaphoric)

sense.name: a count of people or animals
sense.examples: He'll buy 200 head of cattle. There was only one head of pig left on the farm. Tickets to the movie were $5 per head.

sense.name: mind, psyche
sense.commentary: HEAD[+activity][+consciousness] cognitive activity that which is responsible for one's thoughts and feelings; the seat of the faculty of reason
sense.examples: Visions of sugar plums danced in their heads. I couldn't get his words out of my head. It's all in your head. He's got quite a head on his shoulders. (figurative; he is smart, not a large physical head)

sense.name: chief or leader, e.g., of a school or business
sense.commentary: HEAD[+person][+leader] top dog - a person who is in charge
sense.examples: The head of the whole operation gets the corner office. They should go to the head of the school with this problem Who is now head of security? It was announced that the CEO will no longer be head of daily operations.

sense.name: quantity or measure of pressure
sense.commentary: HEAD[+quantity][+pressure] the pressure exerted by a fluid
sense.examples: The engine worked up a head of steam. You'll need a good head of steam to iron out those wrinkles. They are building up a head of steam on the launch of their new video game. (metaphoric)

sense.name: the front or beginning position of something
sense.commentary: HEAD[+relation][+position][+beginning] Note: 'head of NP' highlights a -place- not an anatomical part or quality of the NP
sense.examples: The head of the stairs is over there. Start reading at the head of the page. The SEC has been at the head of this imbroglio from the start. The general rode to the head of his army, leading the way. They tracked him back toward the head of the stream. The photographer had the model stand at the head of the Grecian column. Mary graduated at the head of her class in medical school.

sense.name: top part of a household tool or component
sense.examples: Try to hit the nails squarely on the head. How did you manage to break off the head of this hammer? Sally shook the head of the dust mop over the porch rail.

sense.name: unit of length
sense.commentary: HEAD[+quantity][+measure] the length or height based on the size of a human or animal head
sense.examples: He is two heads taller than his little sister. His horse won by a head.

sense.name: drug user
sense.commentary: HEAD[+person][+consumer][+drugs] a user of (usually soft) drugs
sense.examples: The office was full of secret heads. He was a real acid head in college. The military base was divided into drunks and heads.

sense.name: a difficult juncture in a situation
sense.commentary: HEAD[+state][+context][+difficult] serious straits, a difficult juncture
sense.examples: They are trying to keep the situation from coming to a head. Matters came to a head yesterday.

sense.name: forward movement
sense.examples: We can make no head if we sail directly against the wind. Have they made any head with that sales negotiation. (figurative)

sense.name: muscle
sense.commentary: HEAD[+anatomy][+animal][+muscle][+end] that part of a skeletal muscle that is away from the bone that it moves
sense.examples: Bob experienced sore heads along his forearms after his workout at the gym.

sense.name: beer foam
sense.commentary: HEAD[+drink][+beer][+froth] the foam or froth that accumulates at the top when you pour an effervescent liquid into a container
sense.examples: Don't let her man the keg, she always pours a cup that is half head. Look at all the head on that beer. A well-drawn glass of Guinness has a smooth, creamy head.

sense.name: a specified topic or subject, as a title of a document or subsection
sense.commentary: HEAD[+document][+section][+title] header - a line of text serving to indicate what the passage below it is about
sense.examples: John skimmed the heads of the sections, looking for specifics on power supplies. Your presentation will come under the head of minor Roman poets. (figurative) Make sure that you put the heads of each subsection in bold type.

sense.name: read/write head
sense.commentary: HEAD[+tool][+part][+IO_device][+electromagnet] a tiny electromagnetic coil and metal pole used to write and read magnetic patterns on a disk
sense.examples: The head on this disk drive may be damaged. How fast does the head move during a write?

sense.name: the side of a coin which has the figure of a head on it
sense.commentary: HEAD[+artifact][+coin][+side] (usually plural) an obverse side of a coin that bears the representation of a person's head
sense.examples: Call heads or tails. Heads I win, tails you lose. The head of this coin bears the cameo of Queen Victoria.

sense.name: toilet
sense.commentary: HEAD:[+receptacle][+toilet] a toilet on board a boat or ship slang: any toilet
sense.examples: There is a head on this boat on the starboard side of the bow. The soldiers dug a long ditch to use as a head. The men's head is stopped up again.

sense.name: the controlling component of a grammatical constituent
sense.examples: What is the head of the phrase 'the giant condor of California'? The modifiers must agree in case and gender with the head noun.

sense.name: the crown of a flowering plant
sense.examples: Break the broccoli heads into small florets. The naughty child snipped the heads off the daisies in Mrs. Miller's garden. The ripe, golden heads of the wheat rippled in the wind.

sense.name: a physical protuberance, large or small
sense.examples: Let's climb to the head of Bird Rock to get a better view. The sailors could just see the head of the land ahead through the dusk. The pimple on his nose came to a head.

sense.name: the round compact portion of a structure
sense.examples: The head of the comet was just a point of light through our telescope.

sense.name: a point, as the op part of a compass arrow
sense.examples: The compass head is now pointing due east. The head spun wildly in the presence of the magnet.

sense.name: rounded end of a bone
sense.examples: The x-ray shows stress damage to the heads of her toe bones.

sense.name: the stretched top of a drum or percussion instrument
sense.examples: He beat the head of the drum with a big stick. The heads of those African drums are made of some type of animal skin.

sense.name: oral sex
sense.examples: Mary was appalled when John tried to seduce her by bragging that he "gives good head".

sense.name: delirious, irrational
sense.examples: He was out of his head for days with a raging fever.

sense.name: act unwisely or brashly
sense.examples: She was off her head to go in on that real estate deal. Are you off your head, I'd never go out with Bob!

sense.name: drawing greater depth of water forward
sense.examples: This boat sails by the head.

sense.name: beyond one's comprehension or expertise
sense.examples: His lectures on Calabi-Yau manifolds were over John's head. The sales force is complaining that this new technology is over their head.

sense.name: drastically re-arranged
sense.examples: This project needs to be stood on its head. He is standing the whole department on its head and they don't like it much.

sense.name: a face off, a confrontation
sense.examples: The companies are going head to head in trying to gain market share. John and Pete went head to head in the final round of the robot competition.

sense.name: vastly superior, outranking the others
sense.examples: My Powerbook is head and shoulders above any other laptop I've ever used. Their track record for customer satisfaction is head and shoulders above the competition.
